title: Calories in Beef Broth
meta_description: Discover calories in beef broth per cup, including full nutrition breakdown like protein, sodium, carbs, and fat, plus variations and FAQs.
assumptions: Canned, ready-to-serve beef broth; standard sodium content; no added ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, homemade vs. canned, sodium level, and dilution; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup (240 ml) of beef broth contains about 17 calories and 2.5 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one cup of beef broth?
faqs.a: About 17 calories in 240 ml of standard canned beef broth.

faqs.q: Is beef broth high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, one cup has around 900 mg sodium; opt for low-sodium versions.

faqs.q: What are the macros in beef broth?
faqs.a: Per cup: 2.5 g protein, 0.2 g carbs, 0.4 g fat, and negligible fiber or sugars.
Typically 0 mg cholesterol per serving, as it's a clear broth.

faqs.q: How does homemade beef broth compare in calories?
faqs.a: Homemade is often similar or slightly lower (around 6-7 kcal per 100 ml) depending on ingredients.
